Reviews.Title: “Good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Victor L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In general everything was good, the hotel is close to the train station and for us was great because a couple days later we travel to florence and we could spend more time in rome and not traveling 3 hours earlier to the airport or taking taxis. Our room was really tiny but clean and cozy. Great breakfast and service.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liz K
Reviews.Content: first time in rome. hotel alpi helped to make our holiday amazing. double bed in room when arrived, had requested twin. this was no problem. went to lunch at resturant next door which reception reccomended which was amazing and very resonable, and when returned to room we had twin beds. also lovley plate of fresh fruit. quietist most comfortable hotel i have ever stayed. shower was amazing with fab products. lovley continental breakfast and amazing coffee. dropped a sum of money returning one eve and reception returned it to me following morning. hadn,t even missed it until they called my room. loved the staff from reception to the porters all very freindly and polite. would not hessitate to stay at hotel apli again. stayed for 3 nights in march with my son. perfect hotel for an amazing city break. thankyou hotel alpi. xxx

Reviews.Title: “Confortable & cosy hotel with excelent location in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: GreatDaneDanmark
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 days at the Alpi Hotel during a vacation in Rome. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and our room (343) on the 4th floor had a nice balcony with a view facing the Piazza de Indeppendenza. The bed was confortable , and the room was kept clean and tidy .The bathroom was small, but it did have a jacuzzi , which was rather pleasant. The complimentary breakfast was nice , there was never a problem to get a table during our stay at the hotel. We had drinks at the hotel's bar a couple of times , a nice place to relax before dinner. The hotel's location is perfect , just a short walk from the Termini Station ( if you take the train or bus from the airport) and you can also get a guide tour on a bus from that area. The TV had plenty of channels in 3-4 languages , and the complimentary wireless worked well both on my Iphone and laptop. There were plenty of restaurants in the area , we had dinner in one right next to the hotel and it was nice to experience local tasty food . We took a taxi to Fiumicino Airport (booked via the hotel for 40 Euro) The only negative thing worth mentioning in the hotel, is their tiny elevator , that is so slow that it would make a turtle look like speedy gonzalez ! I would have no problem to return to The Alpi on my next vacation in Rome, can recommend it to everyone !

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with its own charm, the service makes it excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Travelingwtoddler
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean place with excellent service. The breakfast is a nice extra, not what you'd expect from a boutique European hotel. Location is ok...walking distance to the train station which can be good but it's a good 20 minute walk to the big sites. Very good and well priced restaurants next to hotel. I would stay here again and have been 2x already.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: michel01
Reviews.Content: Close to the Central Station, and metro( @ 2 blocks), supermarket close by, and also good restauirants..very good breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Above the average, good price”
Reviews.Author: Anooos
Reviews.Content: Standards 4 stars hotel, with nice and big rooms, just near the main train station of Rome, quite area , view from front side rooms is nice, while back side rooms are facing the internal terrace and its not that much, for Europe to find a 4 stars hotel with a concierge is something, which is available at that hotel, staff are friendly and helpful, breakfast is nice with good variety, the hotel is 15 minutes by walk from the main market area of the city, transportation is easy from the hotel, although nothing important in that area except for the train station. Recommended for Friends, couples, and business travelers who are looking for something above the average with good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to use as a base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Irfan S
Reviews.Content: Unlike others we had no major negative expertiences at Hotel Alpi. I booked there after stumbling across the name from another reviewer. We were looked after from the time we arrived until the moment we departed. Tonino at reception was always helpful, polite and courteous. We stupidly forgot a travel adaptor, which he loaned us. He also gave us local restaurant recommendations and helped us choose train/bus times. The room was good. Clean and not tatty as some people have said. Not too noisy, despite being 1st floor and above the hotek entrance. Bathroom was fine, but shower screen didn't seal properly so water went everywhere - more likely to be a problem for the hotel over time than any guests. Also towels were changed every day, even though we didn't want/need that! Breakfast was OK, and in continental style. It gets a bit samey after a couple of days, but that can't be helped. The waitresses in the breakfast room never once asked us whether we'd like tea or coffee, but seemed to ask the native Italians that somehow... didn't bother us though - we told them what to get us. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms & very hot - but good location”
Reviews.Author: Bobs_head
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a group and the location is great for getting around - it is very close to the bus station so buses to each area are very easy to catch. There is also a taxi rank at the end of the street. All the rooms our party had were tiny - and some better than others. Only 1 of the 3 rooms had been refurbished, and it was certainly the best room. It had been decorated in a modern way with fabric walls rather than grubby & scuffed wallpaper, and a black & white bathroom. In our room the shower (which looked impressive but didn't work properly) was seperate to the toilet and sink. It was a very strange set up - the shower basically opened up in to the bedroom. There was also not enough space in the room with the toilet as you couldn't sit on it properly! You had to sit at an angle, very poor layout. Bedding was clean and the bed very comfortable, especially after long days wandering around the streets of Rome. Soundproofing isn't good, and we were woken up a few times throughout the night from noises outside. Breakfast was very good - usual hams, cheeses, breads, cakes and pastries, a great selection and very tasty too. Overall, I am confused by this hotel. It should be great and certainly has the potential to be. Don't be fooled by the common areas, they do look beautiful, and they are, but the rooms are in dire need of refurbishment... then it will be amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - and a good value”
Reviews.Author: MatteoLC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple nights on my Honeymoon. Very convenient location for travel into Rome, and to local sights. Cool style in the building, as would be expected in Italy. Elevator was tiny, as was the room - but I suppose that is expected also. I plan to come back to this hotel again next time in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Good choice to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sep65
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, very close to Termini. Rooms are clean and quite comfortable, not big but it is Rome. Bed is very convenient and bedclothes are wonderful (extra cleanness). Some rooms look in beautiful small garden/terrace. Bathrooms are small but again it is Rome. Staff is kind and helpful. Try to avoid elevators using, they are very small and extremely slow. To complete the overall very nice picture it is necessary to mention that there are several nice cafe, restaurants and vinotecs close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: valvatti
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Alpi in October 2011. We decided to book this hotel based on the online reviews and the hotel website – and we made a great decision! I expected a lot, but somehow the hotel was even better, what a nice surprise. I really liked the design of the hotel – a successful mix of old and modern at the same time. The hotel and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. Our quadruple room with a balcony in 3rd floor was beautiful and spacious enough for a pleasant stay for two adults and two children (9 yrs and 13 yrs). Absolutely great bathroom, very up to date. Greatly attentive and friendly staff. Good location near and at the same time conveniently far from the Termini Station (approx. 5 - 10 minutes walk). There are lots of restaurants, ATM and a supermarket nearby. A lovely patio for the hotel guests to sit outside and relax e.g. in the evening after exploring all day the great attractions of Rome. The breakfast was abundant – plenty of everything, a perfect way to start the day. There are lots of stairs in the hotel and the elevator is tiny and quite slow, so this hotel might not be the best choice for handicapped persons or families with baby carriages. Free WiFi is a nice extra plus. The weather in Rome in October was warm and sunny and the attractions were not too crowded, it was a perfect time to visit Rome. We really enjoyed our stay in Rome and felt completely at home at this hotel. If I ever return to Rome (I hope I do) I would love to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Close to main station and to many restaurants and sight seeing hot spots. The room was a good size with excellent bathroom facilities. No street noise could be heard with our interior room. Breakfast was good. Elevators are annoyingly small.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel,the staff didn't do hotel justice”
Reviews.Author: barneygumble06
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel last weekend the 20th jan - 23 jan 2012. Hotel was lovely ,well looked after very clean and classy. We had a small double room nice big size bed and one of the nieces bathrooms ive seen in a hotel. The only problem we had in our stay in the hotel was the reception staff at the front desk. We found them very rude and unhelpful. Anytime we went to ask them about any information or just abit of advice we felt they were unfriendly and rude. In any hotel we stayed in before the reception staff are always the best people to give you advice.The hotel was in a quite location and right beside public transport. We had a great weekend in Rome seeing the sites, just felt a classy small hotel like this should have friendlier staff..

Reviews.Title: “Would return for sure.”
Reviews.Author: BrunoBatista82
Reviews.Content: The staff was really nice, always ready to help. The locations was excellent, just 5 minutes from the train station, subway and about 15 from the city historicall center. The food was fresh and diversified. Would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and super convenient to train station”
Reviews.Author: 9Susan9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very elegant yet comfortable. It is close to the Rome train terminal but just far enough where you are not disturbed. Easy for American travelers to find and relax inside if you do not speak Italian because the staff is multiple-lingual and very supportive.

Reviews.Title: “small little boutique hotel near train station”
Reviews.Author: echo_csy
Reviews.Content: this is my second time staying here. I feel secure when staying here. It's about 10 minute walking distance (with luggage) from termini train station. Very near to supermarket where you can find juices, water, bread, tiramisu etc easily. The breakfast is as usual, with great variety from cold cut to fresh fruit. They serve great cappuccino. All staff can speak english, and very nice. Worth to stay again in future

Reviews.Title: “Chic and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Ange999
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this is as a great hotel to stay in when visiting Rome. Some friends were horrified when I told them I was staying near the Termini - however, I had absolutely no problems and, in fact, found it to be a convenient and quiet area. The hotel is set back from the main roads so I heard no traffic noise - unusual for central Rome. The hotel is actually quite chic and the room was very comfortable with a lovely en suite. A bonus was the breakfast - a good continental buffet with a fairly wide choice. There were also some nice cafe bars nearby which were handy for a night cap or a delicious savoury pastry (pasticceria). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “superb Hotel Alpi”
Reviews.Author: tim m
Reviews.Content: what a great place and extremely helpful and amusing staff. thoroughly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again, ciao baby Tim

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: loulou186346
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel. The hotel is clean and well presented in the main. our room was small but nicely decorated. The bathroom was tiny and dated, the shower cubicle was extremley tiny, so much so my partner could not even turn around in it. There was also a bad drain smell which haunted the bathroom daily. The location was good as you are only a 5-10 minute walk from termini, and also not sat directly on a main road so it is quieter. Having said that the area round the termini is dirty, smells of urine and has many homeless people. There were a gang of homeless people that slept near the hotel at night, a little unerving. The breakfast was plentiful but typically continental with no hot alternative. Although you dont generally go to rome to watch television, it is a good job, as there is only one english channel provided and if you want to listen to music or watch a movie, the hotel charges you 5 euros a film. On a positive note, I slept well, the beds are clean and comfortable and as we stayed at the back of the hotel there was very little traffic noise. The air con is also quiet and effective. I would rate this hotel as a 3* rather than 4 and I feel a little frustrated to have paid a 4* price. essentially if you can get a hotel near a metro your winning, but I wouldnt stay near the termini again.

Reviews.Title: “gerard”
Reviews.Author: gerard m
Reviews.Content: stayed 19-23/09/11, found hotel everything it said it was, brilliant bathroom, great air con,staff helpful, excellent location for sight seeing, supermarket and plenty of places to eat very close by. had a great stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Normann Leif P
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, nice staff, good breakfast, nice lokation. When you get a price for a room at the net, you will not get the correct price. When you leave the hotel, they want 3 EURO pr. person pr. day.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: andrewStainesUk
Reviews.Content: the 4 of us ( 2A 2C ) stayed for 2 nights early august prior to embarking on a cruise from rome. It was a lovely hotel. Our room was just what we needed. comfortable, nice bathroom, lovely high ceiling. yes the lift was small but this is an old building so no matter. The man on reception was quite jolly, he tried the hard sale of a bus tour when we were checking in but we just said no, but the map was very handy. The hotel was close enough to Termini to be very convinient but far enough away to be quiet. Continental breakfast was perfectly adequate and plenty of it and fresh and an evening outside terrace to have an late nite-cap if you wanted. Having free wi-fi was also very handy Should we ever go back to Rome we would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Next time in Rome, this is where I'll stay all the time”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Stayed in August 2011 with my wife and chose this hotel because we stayed in a 5 star for our first couple of nights and needed to save some money. Have to say that it wasn't very differernt from the 5 Star. Very pleasant hotel and lovely staff. Great location - close to Termini so you can jump on tour buses very easily, and only a short walk to get the train back to the hotel - very highly recommended (and affordable too!).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, generous breakfast; individual room, not so good”
Reviews.Author: Meigas_fora
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in July. Location is very good, not only as far as transportation goes, but there are also a few interesting things to see in the neighborhood. Breakfast was generous and good. The room is a little too tight, and navigating back and forth can be challenging. Staff was fantastic. The first night, the room was not so good, very little space around the bed, worn down general atmosphere, claustrophobic view out of the window and some noise coming from AC system. I asked about the possibility of moving to a higher floor and, presto, the following day I was able to move (actually, staff moved my bag while I was away, so I didn't have to worry abou it).

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean and close to train”
Reviews.Author: DanielleChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: Just returned - two blocks from termini train station- modern and clean room with friendly staff- restaurants in area very good- we would stay here again with no concerns

Reviews.Title: “Be confident, you'll enjoy a stay at the Hotel Alpi”
Reviews.Author: lakedry
Reviews.Content: Just got back home..... Four of us stayed in a single room. Absolutely no complaints. Room on third floor with Balbony overlooking the square. Brilliant bathroom and a shower to die for....especially after a day hoofing round Rome ! First rate breaksfast (v.important for me)....everything and then some more (no full English.....thank god!) Internet through the TV in the room. Location couldn't be better....quiet, central, business district near to the all important termini... Staff were excellent.....other reviews below a nonsense unless the hotel has since taken note. Businesslike yes.....buit certainly not rude....and very helpful... I'd go again as would my good lady and our 18 and 15 year old sons. Very good value and a definite 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean newly renovated rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Twodavidz
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, 10 mins walk from the main Termini station. Greeted by welcoming friendly staff. Stylishly decorated room looked onto a nice courtyard and had a generous bathroom. Wide selection offered at buffet breakfast and several restaurants very close by. Closest Metro is Castro Pretorio but easy walk to Republica or Termini also. Not the cheapest in Rome but very comfortable and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff”
Reviews.Author: arien007
Reviews.Content: The one thing that stood out for me during our stay was the friendly staff. They were super nice, upon arrival we just felt at home and comfortable. We had a very nice rooms with a balcony overlooking the square. This hotel is at a great location, very close to the train station. As well we could store our luggage at the hotel even though we checked out already. Breakfast was SUPER nice as well. Thanks to all personell at Hotel Alpi that made me and my best friends 1 night expidition in Rome so memorable :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tats802
Reviews.Content: This was a GREAT hotel. When you are trying to pick via the internet and have never been there, it can be hit or miss...this was definitely a HIT. There were 4 adults in 1 room and it was FINE! The room was larger than most European Hotel Rooms, the AC was spectacular especially with the July temperatures in Rome of 95 and above! The hotel was clean, staff was very friendly and very helpful and the breakfast buffet was very very nice. It was a 5 min. walk from the train station and taxis were easily accessible. I would certainly go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay there......... Terrible...........”
Reviews.Author: toknowhow
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel RUDE staff no care at all just terrible Never stay there ....the hole staff need to go have no idea at all how do service and man on the front desk should never have a job in a hotel just rude . Room not clean and bed no new sheets on the bed when it was cleaned stay for 5 days too long and the bed had bed BUGS just so bad .....the worse hotel i have ever been in .The power would go out in the middle of night you phone them they would just flick a switch to restart it just bad !!!!! Dirty Hotel the bathroom floor was dirty and shower you could not move in so small ............Do not Stay there !!!! i wished i had not !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: asl63
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I entered Hotel Alpi as it seems that the negative reviews have a tendency to be remembered first. Hotel Alpi is clean and cozy. Our room was spotless, beautiful and tastefully decorated. The staff couldn't have been more accommodating. The breakfast is typical for the region. It was scrumptious and satisfying. Hotel Alpi is within walking distance to Roma Termini. We felt safe in the area, and we even returned to the hotel from Teatro dell'Opera by foot during the early morning hours, without incident. We sought a hotel in an area that was close to Termini and conducive to the needs of single women: safety, close proximity to historic sites, etc.. When visiting Rome in the future, Hotel Alpi will be my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Hassit
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay great service got a lovely room 112 which had two rooms a little sitting room and separate bedroom very romantic. A walk to termini station and supermarket just around the corner, ideal location

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Great Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Olsenbrown
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening. Andrea was at the front desk to greet us. He assisted us for 5 days with day trip info, and was generally friendly & delightful. The room was beautiful, bed was not super comfortable. Shower sprayed water on the floor. But I don't consider these to be big negatives. The room/hotel was very clean. The breakfast was very nice! Fresh coffee, fruit, yogurt, cheese, boiled eggs, pastries, cereals, very nice. The location was very close to the Termini station, but on a very quiet street. Overall, 4-5 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and pleasant hotel, a bit off center but still at walking distance from many sites.”
Reviews.Author: HRaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Alpi three nights. We found the room (standard double bed) a little small but modern and comfortable. The room was very clean. We had shower in the room, no bath, with sliding door - not always desirable situation. There was no wardrobe in the room, only open shelves and hanger. The reception person were very nice and helpful. The location is 5 minutes from Termini (we took the train from the airport and walked to the the hotel), and during our visit we walked as far as the Vatican or Piazza Spagna (but don't try it on summer time).

Reviews.Title: “Robbery of the goods in the room and the worst receptionists ever!”
Reviews.Author: IvanB2011
Reviews.Content: As promised to the owner and staff of Alpi Hotel I'm writing my own review based on my experience, which is available at all well-known forums regarding the assessment of the hotels. My wife and I arrived in Rome on 12-03-2011 and stayed at the Hotel Alpi, where we earlier made reservation for a room. Unpleasant situation occurred on 18-03-2011, the night before the checking out from the hotel. We began to pack our baggage, and accidentally found out missing of a dress. We repeatedly checked our room, remembered when we saw a dress last time or could we accidentally leave it somewhere (on arrival at the hotel during the day my wife tried this dress). After that the dress was put back into the package in the closet next to the other bags. Upon detection of loss I had dialed the reception. Only after the 3rd call receptionist sent the housekeeper upstairs, who made a visual inspection of a room. The next morning we went for breakfast through reception to inquire the exact status of our complaint. Receptionist arrogantly talked to us, not wanting to understand the situation, pretending nothing had happened. To my statement about contacting the police in case of not finding a compromise, it was said that you can go directly to the police department and nobody would even begin to investigate cloth missing by non-resident. After repeated requests to contact general manager of the hotel my call was transferred to her, who said that robbery is absolutely impossible at this hotel that she trusts "his girls"). I offered a compromise - pay us back spent amount of 175 Euros (strictly on presentation of a check) to settle a conflict situation, to which received refusal. There's no book of registrations of customer requests in the hotel, the hotel operates solely for gaining profit, not for customer service. Immediately after the eviction, we called police, and due to impossibility in Italy to start investigation by phone we went to the police office to write statement for theft investigation. In the end, we stood in a queue for about 2 hours and because of the departure of Eurostar train from Rome were forced to leave. We decided not to spoil our vacation and not to spend half a day on the institution of a case of robbery in another city in Italy. We believe that the hotel does not match its rating. A person who lives in a 4-star hotel should not worry for stealing things! Work of the hotel must be built with the implementation of the mandatory principle of "customer is always right" No representatives of the hotel have not said its regrets or whatsoever in our address. From which it is concluded that the theft at the hotel is a normal phenomenon, which is part of the business. Upon checking out payment was made, and no one even said goodbye to us. I contacted with major agencies/real estate brokers in Moscow for the sale of tours/booking hotel rooms in Italy for advice and even inquiry to cancel any cooperation with Alpi Hotel. This review will be posted in their database, which greatly affects the rating of the hotel. Notice to all Rome visitors - stay away from this hotel, do not spoil your vacations! I can assure the management of Alpi Hotel that actions to the protection of my broken rights will not be limited to this. PS. The ridiculous thing is that upon arriving back home I received an email from Alpi Hotel robot with the offer for additional 5% discount to our further staying.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: rlg67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December and had multiple issues with it from the outset. First night – No room service at 11.30pm despite the hotel being advertised as 24 hour room service on the Agoda website. Ended up going to bed without dinner as we didn’t arrive to the hotel until quite late. Second night - We were woken by the guests next door playing loud music from the tv. Absolutely no sound insulation between rooms and was extremely loud. I complained to reception who managed to get the guest next door to turn it off but we then had to endure the guests arguing until 2.00am. We were then woken again at 6.15am to the guests having sex. I am not talking about us just managing to hear them, it was as if they were in our bed it was that loud. I would expect some level of sound insulation between rooms considering they are supposed to be superior rooms. I complained to the reception in the morning and we were moved to a new room. 3rd night - woken up to due to being extremely cold as the heating system was not working. Phoned reception to request additional blankets at 6.15am but no one would answer! I complained again to reception and asked for the manageress. Was told that she would be there in the afternoon to talk to us. When we went back to the hotel in the afternoon, as soon as we walked through the door the manageress and one of the concierge disappeared. The other concierge told us that they had given us a 10% discount and they would waiver our 9 euro bar bill. When I asked to speak with the manageress I was told she would not meet with us as she was now in a meeting despite being assured in the morning that she would meet with is. However, she would speak to the concierge on the phone when I tried to renegotiate the discount. We were told that there would be no negotiation on the discount and that we would have to deal with it. The concierge also admitted that the heating system for the whole hotel had broken. The whole attitude from the reception staff was appalling and represented absolutely shocking customer service. What sort of manageress is too scared to talk to her guests? We felt as if the inconveniences had been caused by ourselves and that we were to blame. The only positive part of the stay was the porter Ali, as per previous reviews we found him extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “cosy”
Reviews.Author: georgeLarissa
Reviews.Content: cosy hotel close to the main train station (termini) and piazza della republica. I don't know if its due to the economic crisis but the breakfast was very poor. some little problems with the toilet (unpleasant smell, only once to be honest), though the overall impression is very good

Reviews.Title: “Good Location , Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Drixy
Reviews.Content: Its a fairly good hotel when it comes to location and cleanliness, however it lets itself down with the poor service at the reception desk. In fact its so poor , non existent in fact that we even received more help from the porter named Ali. He seemed to be the only friendly and well mannered worker there! Reception service is very offish and they make it very clear as if you bothering them. I would stay here again solely based on the cleanliness of the rooms and location, but the service is appalling. Oh one last thing, you have to pay for TV (English on demand channels) and internet service , at 18 euros per 24 hours. Total rip off. Local tv is free if you speak Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location - Not Safe!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel10Traveler
Reviews.Content: Beware- the posts that say this hotel is in a great location are referring only to its proximity to the train station. It is not a safe area. In fact, if you walk down the street either way, you're met with armed guards and tanks outside the international embassies. The area is overall dirty and is not at all near any of the sites of Rome. Unless you are only staying one night, must be near the train station, aren’t worried about safety or cleanliness, you will regret booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Bus/Train station - Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: burgs001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by other Australians who had stayed here previously. After checking their details on the web, we decided to go ahead. We stayed for five nights and used it as a base for sightseeing. The location was perfect as it was withinin walking distance to the bus and train station. Our room was large, clean and comfortable and as it was at the rear it was also quite. I particularly enjoyed the spa bath to relax in after having walked all day. The staff were very fiendly and the european breakfast was very good. We will definetely go back and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: HotelReviewer99911
Reviews.Content: This is a nasty hotel. It is located in an area near all of the embassy's. Bums and homeless were all around. Our room was disgusting. The staff was extremely rude. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Small and narrow hotel but with good location”
Reviews.Author: xyz1999
Reviews.Content: The Alpi hotel is a nicely situated hotel near the main station in Rome. This place is ideal for starting trips through the antic Roma. However the hotel and rooms are very small and we had to walk a long way between the reception and our room. To reach our room we also had to use two elevators for one of this no alternative stairs were available. One evening this elevator was out of order, so we had to wait until it was fixed as no stairs were available. The breakfast buffet was very small what is typical for Italians. However the breakfast room was very small and one morning we had to wait some time until we got a table. Next time I would try some other hotels around, as the location is very nice. The hotel itself is not providing what for such a price can be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Luxurious and Coveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: TianaV
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights at the end of a 6 week tour of Europe, it was such a releif to have such a luxurious room after some of the places we've stayed at. The aircon was an actual aircon that blows cold air- not like some hotels. The receptionist, porter and bar staff were more than accommodating to us and spoke very good english. The hotel can arrange a private taxi to/from the airport which costs about the same as normal taxi, but is fixed price so they can't do something dodgy. We were about a five minute walk to the main train station, which was two Metro stops from the Colosseum. So convenient!

Reviews.Title: “4 days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Evefrance70
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Very well located and also in a quiet area for Rome, even though being 2 minutes away from Termini station.We were 4 people in a room with 2 double beds, the room was spacious enough. Nicely renovated - modern bathroom, very comfortable beds. Very friendly service. The terrasse is nice for a drink. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JonathanS2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights the hotel. We were given a pretty comfortable and clean room which accomodated 4 of us (2 young kids plus parents). The room was fine although we did spot nicer rooms while the cleaners were cleaning other rooms. The hotel is well situated near the metro and it also has some nice restaurants nearby. It also has a lovely roof terrace although it wasn't being used to its full potential (we couldn't find any staff manning it when we investigated it). The only main criticism was the breakfast, which had slow service, poor coffee and was rather cramped. We also spotted one couple who were waiting outside the breakfast room as it was full up. Not ideal. However the staff at reception were friendly and helpful (they printed out Google road maps when we checked out). Our overall feeling was that this was a perfectly nice hotel for a quick stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Scherene
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Location of hotel was perfect, about 5-10 mins walk from Termini Station. Hotel looked pretty new (perhaps they recently refurbished it?). We enjoyed the Terrace at level 3 every night! nice place to chill out, have a coffee or beer. Our bathroom had rain-shower, no bathtub. Room was facing mainstreet, but hardly any noise. Breakfast was alright, nothing to shout about. Staff were helpful and polite. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: JoJSthlm
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel and liked it very much, We travelled with our 1,5 year old daughter and we got a big room with a lot of space, mainly because of this I guess - which was HIGHLY appreciated! There where though some struggling up and down with all luggage and baby equitment, the very small elevator and so, but the staffed did what they could to help us! The location was for us, arriving to the city by train from the airport, perfect ! Sure it is not the closest to all sights, but a 30 min;s walk to spanish stairs is not too bad. Also they have a charming roof terrace that we spent the last hours in town on. Perfect and with high personal service. The sfaff is not the worlds nicest I've met, but if you gave it a shot they gladly helped you! Can indeed recommed it and will for sure go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and breakfast , highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: cathyobrien
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Alpi for just 2 nights recently at the start of a 2 week italy break. The hotel is modern and stylish. Our room was very big with a nice view over the street and a modern spacious bathroom. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Importantly air conditioning was quiet and effective. The breakfast was typical continental - nice coffee. It is only about 7mins walk from Termini station and we also walked to the colleseum. There are also metro stops within 5 mins walk. We had read mixed reviews before booking but we would highly recommend it - we only paid 90euro per night for both of us and it exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vanvona
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel only for one night on our way back to the UK, we have tried another hotel in a nearby location that was much better and cheaper too. The room was okay, very tight though but the bathroom had broken tiles and the shower head couldn't be kept in place which led to children slpashing water all over. I think this is a 3* hotel that is overpriced, satelite channels were very limited and you had to pay 10 euros to watch a 3-6 month old movie!

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff :-)”
Reviews.Author: gurliK_benhavn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Alpi from juli 14. 2010 - july 20. 2010 and we enjoyed it very much. Good breakfast, fine rooms, fine hotel and fantastic staff. We felt very much like home, everybody were very helpful and kindly, we'll be happy to came back.

Reviews.Title: “Modernly refurbished art deco hotel, very close to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: nymphaeus
Reviews.Content: The Alpi hotel was a very pleasant surprise. A friend booked a room for one night for me, having found a special last-minute offer. The hotel is conveniently located a few hundred meters away from Rome's busy Termini railway station, which serves the airport and all the high-speed rail connections in Italy. This said, the location of the hotel is in a relatively quiet street, somehow removed from the dirt and noise of the crowds that circle around the rail station. The hotel itself is in a very elegant early 1900s building, which has been recently refurbished and furnished with very modern and trendy rooms. Mine was relatively small, but had nice wooden floors, and a large, ultra-modern bathroom decorated with black slate tiles and a shower column open to the sides. Breackfast (included in my rate, was abundant and with good variety). Wireless internet connection was free in the lobby, and offered for a 8 Euro / day price in the room. The pedestrian zone linking the Quirinale hill to Piazza Navona, with all the tourist restaurants, is a bit far away. Yet a number of good restaurants can be found in the same block as the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: oceanbeat
Reviews.Content: The Alpi hotel is conveniently located near the Termini Station and lots of shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is very charming, well decorated, spacious and somehow luxurious. The rooms are big and quite comfortable, the only negative point was the bathroom that didn't have a shower. It was very spacious with big modern bathtub, toilet and bidet but no shower and no curtain. The breakfast was excellent with fresh fruit, different types of breads and pastries, juices, coffee, tea, ham and mortadella. There's a nice terrace to chill and cool down after a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: MichealK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Rome for a few extra days following a two-week cruise. The room was spacious and clean, and the bathroom had a large shower with dual shower heads. When we returned after a tour of Rome, there was a fruit bowl waiting for us in the room. when we checked in, the manager was very helpful in showing the locations of key sites on the map and helped book a tour of the Vatican. [Note: I strongly recommend the private tour of the Vatican. The cost was EUR 60 per person, but was worth it. We were picked up at 0715 by the tour company and entering the Vatican museum doors at 0800. There was a long line waiting for the 0930 general public entrance, but we breezed past them. At the end of the 4-hour tour, the tour bus dropped us off at any of the main sites so we could continue on our own.] Hotel Alpi is about a five-minute walk from the Termini train and bus station, so it is close to transportation; however, the selection of nearby restaurants is limited. The Familia restaurant was good, but the service was slow and our simple meal took over two hours. Eat somewhere downtown before going back to the hotel. Fortunately, there is a supermarket nearby, so we could stock up on water and wine for the evenings. Breakfast was traditional European with a variety of breads, sliced meats, cheeses, cereal, yogurts, and fruits. The coffee was made to order and there were plenty of juices available. The hotel contracted for the pickup at the Civitavecchia port for EUR 150, and drop off at the Fiumicino airport for EUR 50. The ride from the port was pleasant; however, the ride to the airport was a stressful adventure as the driver was constantly on two cell phones talking and texting while taking notes. I recommend taking the train or a bus to the airport. Overall, our stay at Hotel Alpi was pleasant, and we would not hesitate to stay there again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!! Delighted we decided to stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Northseabear
Reviews.Content: After reading comments by other reviewers saying the area was a bit seedy, maybe not a safe place to walk at night etc. we were slightly apprehensive about staying here but after viewing many other hotels online we kept coming back to look at Hotel Alpi. It looked really nice so we decided to give it a try and we are delighted we did! The hotel is situated in a quiet area, approximately 5 minutes easy walk from Termini Station and the area is not at all what we would describe as seedy. At night time we felt safe as houses wandering about the surrounding area full of restaurants and bars! The hotel staff are all very friendly and extremely helpful. At reception they all speak English and Ali the porter deserves a special mention as he went out of his way to make us feel at home. Hotel decor is Art Nouveau, the lift is small but functional and no more than you would expect in a hotel of this age. On the third floor of the hotel there is a terrace at the rear on which you can relax and enjoy a long cool drink after a hard day's sightseeing. We stayed in a superior room on the top floor of the hotel with a small balcony overlooking the front. The room was well decorated and very clean with a very large comfortable bed and ample wardrobe space. The bathroom wasn't large but of acceptable size with a jaccuzi bath, wall mounted shower head (with hose from the bath tap), sink and bidet. What more do you need? The air conditioning worked a treat and there was internet access via the TV. The room was cleaned on a daily basis and fresh towels were also supplied daily. Breakfast was continental style with a very good selection. (For those of you who fancy a traditional breakfast of bacon and eggs etc. you can always nip round the corner to The Yellow Bar in Via Palestro!) We only ate breakfast in the hotel but if the restaurant meals are of the same standard you will not be disappointed. There are several retaurants within a couple of minutes walk from Hotel Alpi. We ate in Osteria (just like Mama used to make!), Barba Rossa and La Vincenze all situated along Via Castelfidardo and in Florians situated in Piazza Indipendenza square and can highly recommend them all. In our experience, Hotel Alpi deserves top marks all round - 10/10 - and we will stay there again during our return visit to Rome next year.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after a cruise with my mom. It was fairly easy to locate (with a map) and very close to the Termini metro station about 4 blocks maybe. We hauled our large suitcases with no problems, but they do have 4 wheels. The room is a bit cramped but on par with the rooms I've stayed at in Europe. The hotel is an older building but they have tried to update the decor. The shower was very nice, however the floor in the shower was very slippery once it was wet, almost dangerous. They did not have free wi-fi like the other hotel we stayed at in Rome the day before our cruise. They do have wi-fi but it was 8 euros a day. The staff was very friendly. The room was small, but it was clean and I would say the location was very convenient if you plan on taking the Metro around town. The area was fine, I did not feel unsafe and we returned around 11 pm at night to the hotel from the Termini metro stop. I was there in late May and it was a cooler night so I cannot rate how their air conditioning is.

Reviews.Title: “TRAUMA of HOTEL ALPI ROME”
Reviews.Author: HenyPang
Reviews.Content: The reason why I chose HOTEL ALPI from booking.com was because its location, cleanliness and good reviews from all visitors. I did not expect that my experience with HOTEL ALPI had caused me GREAT TRAUMA to stay anywhere in ROME. I came here with my parents for holiday with two different bookings for 4 days and 3 nights. The first 2 nights was under my father’s name and the last night was under my name. I have told the receptionist (MR.TONINO) specifically about the 2 different names to maintain the same room for 3 nights. MR.TONINO told me the system has captured it and he even asked for my father and my passport to be recorded down in the hotel system. On the third day my parents were chased out of the hotel with all the luggage and my safety box with password secured being BROKEN IN as the hotel staffs (HOTEL MANAGER ON DUTY WAS MR.ANDREA) wanted to chase us out with all our luggage. I was outside of the hotel then. When I got back to the hotel 4 hours later; I got the shock of my life that the hotel staffs could do that to my parents. As my parents do not speak English, they could not do anything. They were just waited for me outside of the Hotel, as MR.ANDREA did not even allow them to wait at the lobby. On that situation, MR.ANDREA could have asked my parents to pay for the charged incurred for the next day or whatsoever; but he insisted to chase my parents out instead and even prohibited them to use the toilet in the hotel. This is a total insanity that causes TRAUMAS for all of us. The whole experience has spoilt my holiday and IS THIS AN OUTRAGE OF HUMANITY WE ARE TALKING ABOUT IN ROME? I strongly recommend booking.com management team to review the qualification of this hotel as a trusted media for millions internet users and potential customers. PLEASE DO NOT DISCOUNT YOUR LOYAL CUSTOMERS.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: danielb2k3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, Room was very clean and comfy like the rest of the hotel. Bathroom never had a shower but juccuzi bath was good change from the norm and all very clean. Hotel staff spoke good English on the front desk, and the oher staff spoke it a little and were very helpful. The cleaning staff were also good and we left them 20euro we were so pleased. Location of the hotel is very good, very close to the main termini which is the best place for travel to anywhere by bus, train or metro. Breakfast was simple and nice and food area was clean. I would recommend this hotel and the area around it for anyone new to rome as its very close to everything if your not exactly familiar with Rome.

Reviews.Title: “No bells and whistles but It was perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: cecilia87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in late April. It wasn't anything extravagant , but it was a nice clean stay. Breakfast was fine, we didn't expect much but it was great to be able to eat an apple and a piece toast with some juice before we headed out for the day. The only thing i would make note of is that some of the rooms seem more updated then others. We stayed in room 213 and we had a wonderful bathroom with a rain shower while the couple we travelled with had a more outdated style bathroom. It was very close to the train station but i bit far away from most other sights. Walking is possible to the spanish steps, coliseum pantheon, but its going to be a far walk!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad accountancy service : undue 185€ charges taken from credit card”
Reviews.Author: Gabfr
Reviews.Content: With the different plane cancellations due to the Iceland volcano, we arrived 1 day later and stayed 1 day longer (so no loss for the hotel) and though they took us 185€ from our credit card. This had been booked with Booking.com who tried to solve it out with the hotel. So be carefull : we paid the invoice cash at the hotel and had one night extra charges !

Reviews.Title: “Quality accommodations; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Family3some
Reviews.Content: Traveled from Venice for 2 day stay and this hotel was a pleasant experience for us. Not sure what to expect as it was booked by desk in our Venice hotel; happy to report we were very pleased. We took Eurostar train from Venice & hotel is approx 5 mins from Rome Termini train station. Somehow lost my toothbrush & asked desk where nearest Farmacia was/ they gave me a toothbrush/paste - nice! helped in a pinch. Hotel has a lovely terrace (on 2nd level) we were in room 369 (btw loved their hotel keys) & in the evening enjoyed wine, etc. up until 11 pm. Nice breakfast in morning to start the day. Taxis reasonable - 3 of us took from hotel to Trevi Fountain & was 8 euros - totally enjoyed the few days here.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Easy to find”
Reviews.Author: suzyqAustralia
Reviews.Content: Nice convenient location overlooking piazza. Decent size bathroom. Mini fridge didn't work & drinks were hot. When we informed them they sent some one up to fix it. Wi fi will not work above 2nd floor & we were on 3rd floor. Paid for it & then when we could not get it to work they gave us a refund. Good breakfast with nice variety, probably one of the better ones we have experienced so far this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we've been looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Hauschinka
Reviews.Content: Me and hubby stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in May. It is conveniently located close to the Termini station and another Metro station (about 3 min walk) so getting into the town centre was very easy. The hotel was smallish, but nicely decorated, especially liked the dining room. It was very clean and the rooms were ok, pretty much what we expected for this sort of price in Rome. Bathroom was huge and spotlessly clean. Our room had a little balcony too which was nice. The staff, especially the breakfast waitresses, were very helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for metro”
Reviews.Author: asty
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to it's location and closeness to the Metro. This was a very good choice. It was about a 5 mins walk to Termini, which is the best place to be as it links both of the main metro lines which take you to all the main spots. The hotel room was very modern and clean. It was not huge, but was fine. The breakfast was wonderful for a city hotel in europe and the staff were all friendly and welcoming. Check out did take a while, it would help if they did an express check out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Awesome01
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome. Great stay at the hotel. Friendly staff (some communicated well enough in english), clean rooms, and adequate breakfast. Hotel is centrally located to popular sightseeing sites and transportation. In fact, we walked to all sightseeing sites---Vatican, Spanish steps, Trevi fountain, etc. I would definitely stay at Hotel Alpi again. San Francisco, CA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: AalborgLouiseB
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alpi in Rome has a perfect location near Termini. Nice rooms and friendly staff. Breakfast buffet was also very good!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: e_mertens
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive reviews on this site I tried this hotel in central Rome. The rooms were clean (quite small though), price reasonable (90 eur a night) and location good, I wasn't impressed with the service. They forgot to wake me up at the time I asked, then failed to apologise, ordering a taxi was a trouble, getting coffee at the breakfast table took 20 minutes, the overall attitude of the front staff was not too positive. And the funny thing was that using internet in your room cost you mone, and they never said that while checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreVz
Reviews.Content: Elegant cosy hotel. Good location near subway entrances and railway station, but also duable to walk around on foot to the city center. Nice rooms will garantee you a good night sleep! Charming breakfast room, even though it didnt have windows! This hotel is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Scariest Elevator ever”
Reviews.Author: GotLaptopWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel altogether but not the 4-stars that it claims on some sites. Room was small, bathroom facilities were ok. Were there during a cold & wet week in December and the heating wasn't able to keep it warm enough for clothes to dry, with the balconies it's a better hotel to go to in summer Depressing breakfast room without windows and smallest elevator (with its own peculiar noises) ever!

Reviews.Title: “Jacuzzi Bath and Heating in Bathroom didn't work”
Reviews.Author: Babs61
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here as a pre-valentine treat on our way back from a business trip. I researched long and hard for a 4 star hotel near the train station and i finally settled on Hotel Alpi and i got a good rate through Venere.com. The room was small but the bathroom was large so that made up for it. We didn't request a jacuzzi bath and actually would have preferred a room with a shower. However we decide it would do and after settling into our room i decided to try out the bath - firstly the heating in the bathroom was off and then the jacuzzi element didn't work. I didn't ring down to report it as my husband was sleeping and I didn't want people coming into our room at that stage. We had previously had a gin & tonic in the bar and the tonic was flat. I did however report it on check out the next morning and all i got was an apology. I wouldn't stay here again as it is not up to 4 star standard - these rooms should be checked before someone moves into them and when things are not up to standard a discount at least should be offered but not the case here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alpi is a little hidden gem, clean as a whistle, gracious and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: SQ3
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff is welcoming and polite. The buffet breakfast (included) was delicious and complete. The waitress even made cappuccino for me, which was steaming hot and delicious. The marble floors throughout were glistening. Our room, though small, was very clean and tidy, quiet and comfortable, and very beautifully decorated, along with free internet. The water in the shower was nice and hot. The price was reasonable. The location is near the main train station, subway and busses, and right across the street from a little park. We walked into the center of Rome in 25 minutes. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel. It was definitely a pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSIDE CITY CENTRE BUT CLOSE TO MAIN TERMINI..NICE ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: THIEF-HENRY
Reviews.Content: Rooms very nice & clean with good mini bar,lcd tv and nice bathroom. No iron or tea making facilities.Breakfast ok but nothing to write home about.Location was fine for us but for older visiters maybe a city centre hotel more suitable.Hotel is 5 mins from main termini where you can get metro to every worhwhile location-COLLOSEO 3 mins, VATICAN 10 mins, TREVI FOUNTAIN 5 mins SPANISH STEPS 5 mins... so ideal for base to see everything without spending too long traveling.Also we were going to sorrento for 1 day so wanted to be close to train termini.Area outside temini very run down with alot of beggars so be careful but you'll be fine when you pass every day of your stay so dont worry too much they keep to themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DijanaZagreb
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on good location 5 min walk from Termini station. Rooms are clean, breakfast is big choice but not too good for 4 starts hotel (you cant get eggs, pancakes... even if you wanna extra pay for it). Cappuccino and hot chocolate in hotel are super! You can here people walking around hotel when you are sleeping... Staff on reception are very nice! Carfull -TV is paid extra!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice close to train”
Reviews.Author: daetime
Reviews.Content: After reviewing Tripadvisor reviews of hotels in this area we chose Hotel Alpi because it is walking distance from the train station. We arrived by train in the evening from Venice and we were leaving by train at 7:30 a.m. We booked from the hotel web site and got a last minute discount rate. Alpi is a small, quiet and attractive hotel. The fourth floor room looking out on the terrace was very small but nicely decorated, I would guess recently updated. The bed was very comfortable, the air conditioning was great. The room had a bit of an odd odor (maybe the carpet?) but the air conditioning dissipated the smell by the time we returned from dinner. The room had a nice TV, room safe, minibar. The bathroom was good size but the smallest shower stall I have every seen. The water pressure was good. The tiny elevator could not take two people and luggage. We left before breakfast was served. Rain prevented up from enjoying the terrace. We walked to a wonderful restaurant Andrea on Via Castelfidardo, excellent pizza and pasta, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: betseyScotland
Reviews.Content: We trawled long and hard through sites to find a good hotel in Rome. There were so many mixed reviews. Hotel Alpi consistently got good reviews so we went with them. We weren't disappointed. The location was very close to the Termini station which was mainly why we choose it as we were arriving in Rome late in the evening and didnt fancy tackling the public transport system. The rooms were spotless and modern and our bathroom was huge. The night receptionist was somewhat gruff however we put this down to being Italian rather than actual rudness. The hotel itself is lovely and well maintained. The breakfast room is small and was very busy both mornings. One morning we were completely overlook by one of the two waiting staff, it's self service so we didn't starve but we didn't manage to get any coffee! The next day we were served quickly - but still only two girls on duty. We really only slept in the hotel as Rome is so huge that we were out sight seeing all day. There was a left luggage option for our last day and when we arrived the receptionist let us use the facilities to freshen up for our journey home. Overall this is a very nice hotel, in a good location and well priced. I would definitely stay here again and I would recommend it. The guide books say that it is in a dodgy part of town but we felt perfectly safe and didn't see any trouble, just a couple of down and outs hanging about a park. Good hotel and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable Family Room”
Reviews.Author: Sandra040
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alpi is located close to the Termini Station where most of the Hop-On Hop-Off Tour buses depart from. We were a family of 5 staying in the Family Room, which consisted of 2 queen beds and a single bed. The bed's and pillow's were extremely comfortable. The staff at the reception desk were not very friendly but Ali the Concierge was absolutely fantastic, always with a smile!!

Reviews.Title: “very romantic place but a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: borderlineLondon
Reviews.Content: The Alpi is definitely a very nice place for a romantic getaway. The rooms are a bit small but their odd L shape make them seem more spacious than they actually are, and the entire hotel is very tastefully decorated in a romantic way. The location is quite convenient in the sense that it is near the station and many pretty good restaurants; it is not the fanciest neighbourhood in Rome nor the nicest to walk around in, but it is close enough to many of the sites (and you can easily take public transport). The rooms are very quiet, at least ours was as it was facing the courtyard. The above having been said, I didn't feel the Alpi was particularly great value for money. We paid EUR 185 per night; I guess that isn't bad for a 4 star hotel in the middle of Rome, but I noticed little things that made me wonder. The toilet, for example, was particularly cramped, and no matter what you did the floor was soaked after you took a shower. The breakfast buffet is decidedly uninspiring, and there are no windows in the breakfast room (there is in general a dearth of natural light in the hotel). The internet is not free. All this stuff probably wouldn't have bothered me if we had paid EUR 120 or 130, even 150. But after having paid 185, I was left wondering if it wouldn't have been better to pay 210 or 220 and got something much nicer. It's hard to say as I go to Rome very seldom and don't know the market, but all of this is worth keeping in mind. If I were to go to Rome again, I wouldn't be adverse to staying at the Alpi again, but I might think hard about it if I couldn't get a better deal

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a Big City hotel”
Reviews.Author: tardiswho
Reviews.Content: Clean, good size room, good location, staff accomodating, some good restaurants nearby

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: P0ul
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel close to Termini, walking distance. Buses from Piazza Indenpendenzia to central Rome. Clean room, very nice terrasse. Better hotel than most hotels close to Termini Station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Terrace - Place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: bert1208
Reviews.Content: Easy walk from train station to hotel. Fruit basket in room upon arrival. Hotel was very clean, good breakfasts and okay proximity to metro station. The terrace was a great place to relax with the family for a drink and play a game and the end of a busy day sightseeing. Unable to convert US$ to Euro at front desk so we needed to find a cash station. Front desk personnel were friendly and engaging in the sights of Rome. The location requires that you take a cab/metro/bus to get to the majority of sights but that is 10 to 15 minutes time. The location is near the train station and is not as refined as other parts of Rome but it worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: swisschar
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hotel Alpi. We had a very spacious room on the fifth floor. A complimentary fruit basket was delivered to our room which was very nice. The staff was very friendly. The lift is very small so if you have issues with tight spaces you may want to ask for a room on a lower floor. Breakfast was included in the price. The Termini Station was about 3 blocks away so the location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “If in Rome stay at Alpi”
Reviews.Author: linkkarl
Reviews.Content: A small luxurious Hotel conveniently located. Great Breakfast buffet and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Roma v Lazio”
Reviews.Author: anfieldtravel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Great staff, great room, what else could you ask for!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but doubt i'd use it again ....”
Reviews.Author: Chez_London
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome in June for a conference but continued my trip to the weekend where I stayed at Hotel Alpi. I was a little disappointed with our room, but we were only there for 2 nights so we didn’t complain. The room was extremely dark due to having no natural light as our window opened on to a very small court yard, which made it feel very claustrophobic. Also, our Air Conditioning kept turning itself off, even though the room was still hot. As noted in previous reviews, there are no English channels on the TV, but why would you visit Rome to watch TV, so this didn’t affect us. Generally the hotel was clean and very tidy, and the staffs were extremely friendly. The breakfast was what I expected, continental foods i.e. hams, cheeses, bread etc, if you’re expecting eggs and bacon you’ll be disappointed. One main point I’d like to mention is the fact the roof terrace is not available free of charge, maybe I re-read the information on the website, but I assumed this roof terrace had a bar area where we could have a drink and eat our breakfast, this was not the case. To have the privilege of using this terrace there was a service charge of EUR10. The location was not ideal, I’ve visited Rome twice now and my favourite areas are Trastevere and the Pantheon, which is a good 30/40 minute walk from this hotel. Which doesn’t sound too far, but after a day of walking non stop in 30 degree heat it’s not great. Although, there were a few bars and restaurants near the hotel but I can’t comment as I didn’t try them. Personally, I would rather be closer to the main areas, but if you like to be away from that then this is definitely a good choice in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: beckmey1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alpi is a friendly, clean, cost effecient and very hospitable small hotel located a few minutes walk from Termini Station. While not that close to some of the more frequently visited tourist attractions, it is, nonetheless, well positioned for the experienced traveler (train, taxi, bus) who might like to stay out of the crowds. Well kept and maintained, it is in close proximity to small fine small restaurants and shops. We would, without a doubt, stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a little gem”
Reviews.Author: JustmeLeeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night with my husband, we were passing through Rome so we needed to be close to the train station (Termini) but it is still a good location for seeing the city. The hotel itself is lovely, obviously recently refurbished, our room was on the ground floor so had a little street noise but then when you are staying in an Italian city this is what you would expect or even enjoy. The room itself was fabulous, really chic and modern, with a fab en suite boasting a wet room type shower. The lobby was lovely and breakfast room really quite charming, we enjoyed an excellent breakfast with a selection of meats, cheeses, cereal, fruits, cakes, everything really. We also ate dinner in a great little trattoria just up the road towards Via XX Settembre, Andreas, excellent food. Anyway, definitely to be recommended, I will stay there when I go back. Just one pointer, I wouldn't walk around the area on my own at night, I'd get a taxi just to be safe but that is absolutely no reflection on the hotel, it's just that you walk near the bus and train station and they are never good anywhere at night. Ok in company though.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing....”
Reviews.Author: ClowesCloset
Reviews.Content: This is a great 4* hotel, right in the heart of the termini area, great location, great staff, excellent buffet breakfast, very knowledgeable staff, i would highly recommend it especially when you are walking all day, its nice to have a little luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: OK10splayer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alpi was very clean and conveniently located near the Termini station. We enjoyed our stay and felt that the staff were all very nice. We visited two other cities in Europe and this was most pricey but we did enjoy our stay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: andco
Reviews.Content: Good value. Room not large but bathroom was large and well done. Cold breakfast well done in nice room. Cheerful help. Convenient location near Termini Station. Market and family restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: RyanS17
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to train station. Great breakfast. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet and intimiate”
Reviews.Author: rhinocheeks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Rome as first time visitors - we booked the Alpi last minute through booking.com on a promotional deal. We looked at the website and reviews and felt like we had something to look forward to. We were not disappointed - I am not sure if we were upgraded but our room was spacious, clean and decorated to a high standard. Granted the bathroom was tiny but it was clean and servicible, with a shower/bath, loo, basin and bidet. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were not great - being feather my husband is asthmatic and this could be a problem for other people with the condition. You can't see in the photo but the furnishings were lovely mahogony and very elegant. The location was fine wih only a 5 minute walk to Termini station - also a bus terminal. Breakfast was continental style and it made a nice change for us to tuck into cold meats/cheese/toast/fruit etc rather than bacon and eggs! The only criticism I would have is that the hotel advertises airport shuttle and I was lead to beleive this was included in the rate. However, this cost 50 euro each way..... we took the train back to the airport - this was very quick and easy to do for 10 euro leaving from platform 25 at half hour intervals - I would not hesitate to use the train next time we visit Rome. I would stay at the Alpi again if I returned to Rome as we felt very comfortable there and it was lovely and peaceful at night with no noise from the street. As first time visitors to Rome we had to learn quickly as we only had the weekend so other than the above tip about the airport shuttle you may find the following tips useful. The Italian waiters are very good at getting you sit down and have coffee - make sure you check the price before you do - we got stung twice and it cost us 20Euro on once occasion for 2 coffees! I would not recommend the open top tour buses unless you have the patience of a saint! Virtually every stop means a 15 minute wait while the coach people drum up more business - take into account 12 stops around the city and this is a very long time! It is just as easy to use the number 40 bus which costs 1 euro ..... the tour bus cost 15 euro ..... Don't be tempted to be fooled by the tour guides outside the colleseum who will try and tell you its an hour queue to get in - the queues can look long but trust me we got through within 15 minutes - the english speaking tour guides are italian who speak broken english with a very strong accent .... we paid for this service and are still non the wiser .......probably better to get the audio guide. The vatican city is fabulous and shouldn't be missed - this is free entry and will take a few hours to see everything possible. The Michaelangelo and the cistine chapel are in the Vatican museum - this is not free and is about 1km from the vatican city - this is not free and costs 14 euro each. Finally Rome is very expensive but it is quite easy to cut back by using the snack bars rather than sit down restaurants. We ate out both nites in restaurants and dinner for two - starters and main with a bottle of wine was near on 100 euro each night - and we didnt go for the most expensive stuff on the menu ..... taking into account the exchange rate at the moment this soon adds up.

Reviews.Title: “Our family liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mahgee
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 nights on FEB 2009 in a family room for four. Adults and two children aged 20 and 14. The hotel is very nice and clean. Our room was sunny and we liked the view to the street and park. "Family from Finland"

Reviews.Title: “value for money: clean, modern rooms close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: hannibal22
Reviews.Content: The Alpi hotel has small but modern and clean rooms in an old building. Our room had to be accessed through naroow corridors, two (!) tiny elevators and a staircase but that's a minor thing. Service is "Italian style" but in the end you get what you want (luggage handling, directions etc.). Breakfast is modest but ok. Located between Termini and Castro Pretorio metro station. I went there with my 9-yr old son and I can recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “lovely,frıendly,helpfully and so sweet....”
Reviews.Author: doğaduru
Reviews.Content: Receptıon persons very very well,hotblood,frıendly,warm and helpfull.....rooms are clean,breakfast enough for normal guests..I advıce ....for thıs prıce take a very good servıce...above average....and stıuatıon is very close everywhere....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: smudge_mail
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be more happy with my stay at the Alpi. Close to Termini station it was ideal for getting out and about, and expoloring what Rome had to offer. The room was fantastic, far better than i hoped for. It even had its own balcony & jecuzzi bath (although no shower)... superb and all for 180 euros for 2 nights. The service from the breakfast team was top class, and plenty of choice too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alpi, a great find”
Reviews.Author: Willo1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Alpi for 1 Saturday night in August this year having arrived by train. The hotel is a ten minute walk from Termini station, and is an ideal base for joining site seeing tours or walking. Our family room was comfortably spacious for our family of 4, and being on the top floor, we had a beautifull view from our large balcony. The hotel has a classy feel, and the staff are charming, friendly and very helpfull. Breakfast buffet was varied, with the best coffee I have tasted, and the open air bar on the third floor around the courtyard is a lovely place to end the day. When I return to Rome, I will stay at hotel Alpi again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations set, but not met”
Reviews.Author: Grace031
Reviews.Content: I was looking to "splurge" on a luxury hotel for my husband and I for our last night in Rome. Following a recommendation in National Geographic Travel magazine, which listed Hotel Alpi as a lovely, Art Nouveau hotel near Termini station, I promptly went to Hotel Alpi's website to check it out. The photos showed rooms that appeared spacious, new (or at least recently renovated), charming, and tastefully decorated. I booked the "Superior Room," which from the photos, looked to be a small suite. When we arrived at Hotel Alpi, we waited in a long line to check-in (there was only one desk attendant, but we easily excused this. After all, this is listed as a small, family run hotel.) The lobby looked like everything we could have imagined: gleaming white marble, giant Rococo tapestries and elegant overstuffed couches. When we entered our room, however, I thought there surely had been a mistake. There was nothing "superior" about this room; it was a standard hotel room. What's more, the room was a cramped, dark and musty cell with outdated deep green and navy blue furnishings trimmed with 1970s peuce yellow curtains. Awful! I went back to the desk to see if we had been given the wrong room. No, I was told, this was one of their best rooms and if I didn't like it, that was another matter. I mentioned that it didn't look anything like the room I thought I booked through the website (I wasn't expecting the fresh flowers and mood lighting like in the photos, but come on!) The quick-witted concierge told me that he too looked beautiful in photos. He said very humorlessly that he wanted to make me happy. If I would wait an hour, another Superior Room on the third floor would be ready. I went back upstairs to await his call, but it never came. My husband and I moved our own bags into the new room, which was little better than the first. This room had more light, but we lost the terrace that the first room had. It was just as small and dreary (monochrome grayish brown, simply hanging a painting in the room would have done wonders for it). The carpet looked stained in places and the furniture was overworn with scratches all over it. Also, we were told there would be a jacuzzi tub and there was only a standard tub in the cramped bathroom. It's also worth noting here that the lights kept malfunctioning in our room (they took 10 Euros off of our bill for this inconvenience). We also had to wait forever for the elevator and on the last day, it finally broke down altogether with my luggage in it. I feel at great pains to say something redeeming about this hotel so ... my husband told me that the breakfast was very good. But all in all, Hotel Alpi either needs to raise their standards or lower their guests' expectations. In my opinion, they also stand to lose one or two of their four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if all you need is a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: estaci12
Reviews.Content: Rooms were tiny but clean. Service was quite average. WiFi didn't work, and neither did the internet cable in the rooms. This was on weekend so there was no one to fix it. Guy at reception couldn't care less.. their 'concierge' is also the guy at the coffee shop in the veranda upstairs and also the guy who 'fixes' (unsuccessfully) problems in the rooms. If you're staying in the middle of the summer, make sure the air conditioning in your room works. Ours didn't - and opening the windows at night makes it worse!

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose.”
Reviews.Author: quantumphd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night after arriving Rome then continuing to Siena. We thought the hotel was very quaint. It had small rooms, was clean, and had hard beds. Also, we thought they had the best free breakfast buffet of our 17 days in Italy. It was within walking distance of the tremini and metro stop and wasn't too hard to find. We would stay here again for a short stay and we thought it accommodated out needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find and Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: HGPLynnE
Reviews.Content: Heading to Rome on a short schedule and tight budget, selected the Hotel Alpi because of its reasonable rates and that they would accept a credit card at checkout. Hotel easy walk from Termini Station with its access to the subway and bus lines, Hotel was tastefully decorated. Our room had a king sized bed, desk, refrigerator, safe, two person whirlpool tub. Desk clerks were friendly and helpful. Grocery store a block away. Small bar in lobby. Complimentary breakfast included fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, breads, and more. Yes we did see homeless people near Termini Station, but it is not that unusual for a major metropolitan city. If we have a chance to return to Rome would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very average for the price”
Reviews.Author: dee030dublin
