Reviews.Content: disappointing room. shower was in the bedroom no window in shower room , musty smell. could hear kids in neighbouring room early in the morning. location wise 30 minute walk to the main attractions like trevi fountain. not worth the expensive price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DohaShredder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Its very close to the main train terminal; the area is safe. . . .and well; inside. . . will be impressed. The rooms are wonderfully decorated; okay, the bathroom was small. . .but very stylish; and the with a jucuzzi inside; what can is say!!? One tip for non regular travellers; Don't use the phone in your room, it costs a lot!!! Do not hesitate in booking this hotel; especially good for young couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mslagirl
Reviews.Content: We really ejoyed our stay at Hotel Alpi and would recommend it for families. I did quite a bit of research online and corresponded with the hotel itself before booking. I was still nervous though! You never know if the pictures are current, etc..We stayed in a family room on two separate occasions on our trip to Italy. Both rooms were very spacious. one of the showers was small by american standards but we found small showers to be quite common in Italy. Our rooms were on the street side and had no problem with noise. Everything was clean and well kept. Breakfast was more than enough to satisfy. The coffee was out of this world! I miss that a lot. The staff was very nice to us and even remembered us when we checked in the second time. The hotel is close to the Termini station but we walked most everywhere. It was very easy to get to the sights on foot. Besides, it was a good excuse to stop and have some Gelato on the way! We took the bus to Vatican city but otherwise we really enjoyed experiencing the city a little more intimately. we never felt unsafe in the neighborhood around the hotel. We brought 3 children and that was a big concern. We were out every night after dark and never had any issues. There are some great little restaurants close by. I would highly recommend this hotel - Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant mistake”
Reviews.Author: tybo
Reviews.Content: We were suppossed to stay in the yes hotel but they overbooked us ,ask for a superior room. the location is not the most pleasing but it is great for getting around rome. nice little bar on the patio open late. front desk was very good. never tried the breakfast. try mama angelinas down the street for dinner ,great service and staff. best meal in rome

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickso1979
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely modern 'boutique' style room with modern amenities, a fabulous bathroom and an essential balcony. Staff were helpful and friendly and the ample inclusive continental breakfast was a bonus with costs in Rome. Pricewise, there is little to complain about - this is a mid-range hotel and for a short stay it was perfectly adequate for our needs. That said, the room was very much on the small side (but that is to be expected in Rome) and was accessed by a strange little elevator which was most certainly not for those with even the remotest fear of confined spaces - if you are booking this hotel I would double check room allocation if this is a factor. Considering this and what we saw of the other hotel rooms, I suspect that quality of experiences at this hotel may be a bit hit and miss. The hotel is a little dated, and having seen into some other rooms it looked as though we had one of few nice ones. Locationwise, the hotel is very handy for the main train station and since it is easy to get around Rome anyway then location was not a problem - nonetheless, I would not stay here if I was travelling alone, nor if travelling with one or two other females, because it is not a particularly nice part of town and I felt a little intimidated at times even when with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “wasn't dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: muziklv
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to Termini - we walked all the way with luggage and 2 kids. No problem with feeling safe, although there were some rather questionable personalities on our path. But we walked every day during different hours with no problem. It's part of being in the big city. Staff was friendly and helpful as much as can be expected when hotel is fully booked. Our room(quad) was large and had everything I asked for during reservation. What I asked for was having a balcony and a shower instead of a tub. They fulfilled that. The only problem was smell in the room - either from carpet in the hall or from air conditioning. When I complained they sent a guy to spray the room around which didn't do much. Well, we decided to tolerate it since overall the room was good. Loved the balcony which was long and connected room and bathroom. Step in the bathroom was a little dangerous especially at night, but it was large, much spacier then other hotels'. This hotel has a very large variance of rooms, so it's hard to judge whole hotel by one room. In elevator we saw pictures of other rooms which looked ultra modern and huge. Don't how to book them, maybe just luck. Elevator is small, as usually in Europe, and it takes forever to come, so we used stairs instead. They have very nice cozy courtyard off the second floor. it's a great spot to relax after day of sightseeing. We really liked their breakfast and our kids even more so. Tasty cold cuts, cheeses and deserts among other things. Coffee to order was very good. Breakfast room was large enough and tables were always set nicely despite such a large crowd. Another convenience - close to Metro stop, which was our main transportation (kids loved it) and many bus choices as well. Overall we had a very positive experience (if only not for that smell). Yes, maybe staying in a more central location would be better, but it was on a quiet street and we liked it at the end of the day with kids being tired. After all, how much time can you spent in the room while being in Rome?

Reviews.Title: “Book a superior room”
Reviews.Author: hotelqueen
Reviews.Content: I tried to book a double superior room, but only a standard was available, it was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in! There was only enough space in the room for one person to get dressed at a time and the shower was so small that if you dropped the soap it was impossible to bend down to pick it up without opening the shower door! The hotel is in a good location, very clean and is good value, but I would only stay again if a superior room was available.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: nainaandnic
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and the rooms were nice. What I found very dissapointing was the staff and the room they gave us. I told them before that we are starting our honeymoon with them. They didn't care and were not friendly. They also gave is a small room even though we didn't pay the cheapest amount. When I informed that, they said.. oh well we are fully booked, come back tomorrow. Shame. I will not be recommending this hotel to anyone. We went to several hotels after and they were lovely. naina and nic

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Indyrk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Alpi in early September 2007 with wife, and two small children. Room was huge! Much larger than expected. We did book a quad room. Room had a nice, though small, balcony. Do note, that this room, and at least one other that our friends stayed in do not have showers! The tubs are huge (and very clean), and have removeable shower heads, but this was a bit of a surprise. Breakfast was great! As good as we had anywhere else on our trip. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Alitalia had lost our luggage, and the staff allowed us to use the house phone to make several international calls free. Location is good, a 5 minute walk to Termini. We were able to do this walk with all our luggage. Though if it can't all roll, you'd probably need a taxi as you have to cross several busy streets. Handy to walk there and catch buses to the main tourist attractions we were interested in. Several reasonable restaurants nearby. Would stay here again if in Rome. -RK

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Value”
Reviews.Author: CultureHound
Reviews.Content: A friend who only travels "first class" sent me his itinerary for Italy and on it was "Hotel Alpi". Since we were going to Rome, I decided for chuckles to see how much he was paying for the room (I figured several hundred dollars per night). To my surprise, I could get the room for 79 euros/nt for one night and slightly more for the following 2 days, going through the hotel's website. PROS: location was close to the main train and local bus station at Termini; about 100 yards to a cheap neighborhood grocery store called "Supermercati" (bought inexpensive yummy wine and cheese as well as our waters and snacks); great breakfast with lots of options and a beautiful dining room; beautiful lobby and waiting area; gorgeous hotel room; could for a fee of 8 euros extra per day use hotel room tv as an internet computer; close to nice, reasonable restaurants; good a/c; comfiest bed and pillows in Italy; ultra-modern bathroom and shower (kind of felt like a Manhattan penthouse); nice decks where we had our wine and cheese in the evening CONS: elevators tiny; our room (309) needed a second elevator (weird and a bit scary) to get to; shower difficult to turn on and you had to get wet to turn it on and get a blast of cold water to turn it off; no place to put toiletries in shower - and I mean NO PLACE except the floor!; booking on internet was a major drama but hotel called me at my hotel in Florence to get my credit card info (which I couldn't input on their website for some reason) OVERALL: stay here! very convenient to most everything. I would definitely return and recommend it - especially for the price we got!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mashinka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Alpi hotel during Xmas 2006. It's very conviniently located 10 minutes from Termini station. The elevator is kinda funny, very small and it takes forever but it's very nice anyway. We stayed on the top floor, room with the balcony and we loved it. Very roomy that is not like most european hotels, very clean bathroom with all stuff that you might need. Safe was in the room as well. It was also very quiet which is very important to us.Breakfast was ok, nothing special and you can always have a great coffee and a sandwich to die for right outside the hotel. They provide you with maps, flyers etc and recommended a rest to have a dinner on Xmas Eve when a lot of places are closed. Thank you! For the price it was the best value and we're definately coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, needs a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: texan75225
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three rooms at the Hotel Alpi in late June of 2007. Overall, I was pleased and would recommend this hotel to anyone trying to stick within a certain budget in Rome. It is hard to find a great place to stay for this price. The location was very good. We were a group of eight and arrived by train from Naples to the Termini train station. We were able to walk the few blocks to the hotel with no problems. The hotel is small and historic with high ceilings, a modern lobby, and a lovely bar and breakfast room. The breakfast buffet included in the room price was very nice. We booked one quad room and two doubles. The quad I stayed in was HOT the first night and sort of shabby- it was at the front the hotel overlooking the front entrance. There was a musty odor from the dirty carpet in the entry of the room. The next night we were moved to the back of the hotel to a much nicer triple with an extra roll-away bed. The room was more modern in design and had a small balcony overlooking the inner courtyard of the hotel. My teenage son and his friend were pleased with their small double room. It also overlooked the inner balcony and there was no trouble with the air-conditioner in this room. The liked the TV etc. My friend and her son were not pleased with their room. She was unhappy about the air-conditioning but there was not another room for her to move to. Personally, I would stay here again during a time when a/c is not absolutely needed. I thought it had more pluses than minuses.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: louise28k
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel Alpi for 6 nights in mid Aug and I have to say this is a gem of a hotel. It is in an excellent loaction, only a 5 min walk from the station where you can get on any bus or train to anywhere in the city. We found the staff to be extremley helpful and friendly, room was very nice, cleaned everyday, small balcony and flat screen tv with english tv channels. Breakfast was excellent everyday, huge selection and service was great. I would recommend the hotel to my friends and would stay here again. A wonderful hotel in a great location at a bargain price

Reviews.Title: “air conditioning doesn't translate into furnance”
Reviews.Author: orange2795
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Rome in the warmest summer, just coming from an air conditioned room (2-star )in Bologna, thinking we couldn't wait to cool off in our room. Boy were we taken aback at this "4-star hotel" cooling system-the room was hotter then the outside street air. Even the hotel entry was cooler. The hotel stated the room air conditioning wasn't as good- it was sending out heat.. Boy were we disappointed, especially when we came from Hotel RE-ENZO Bologna,Italy : three times the room size, lower hotel category , less cost and an air conditioner which had to be turned off because the room got tooo cold. But not a complete loss. The hotel boy was so kind to look at our unit and found it lacking in performance and brought us a fan-which made the hotel experience tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Family of Five”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOfFiveGermany
Reviews.Content: Family of Five: Nice Hotel, bad room (Room # 315, family room). The room made an otherwise nice hotel, a less than satisfactory experience. There was a distinct odor of urine in the room which I suspect was in one or more of the mattresses. The air conditioner wasn't sufficient to cool the room (which made the smell worse). Air fresheners and our request for A/C repair made no improvement. Our request to change to another room was denied. No discount offered. Miserably warm, smelly room. The rest of the hotel was very nice as was the included breakfast. Only a six minute walk to the train/bus/metro/subway station (Termini). A grocery store was on the same block between the hotel and the Termini. An excellent restaurant (probably the best we've experienced in Europe) called "Babbos" is three blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs-up”
Reviews.Author: faroutDublin
Reviews.Content: Staff were professional and friendly, and promptly sorted out myself and my travelling mate's requests (extra pillow and the mending of a shower head that refused to point the way I wanted). Ample buffet breakfast, serviced by two pleasant but overworked kitchen staff.

Reviews.Title: “Easy location, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: AndrewMichael
Reviews.Content: Due to a usual Alitalia strike [surprise surprise, why is this airline even exist?!], we arrived in Rome super late around 12:15 am, after an original arrival time of 1: 15 pm, the previous afternoon! Hotel Alpi was sympathetic and great during check-in after explaining the airline mess. We got a "1st floor" [in Europe, that means 2nd floor] double room. It was pretty spacious, and had a huge balcony [the balcony right over the entrance of the hotel.] Great views, great location, very quiet! The next morning, breakfast and check-out were efficient. I would def. recommend Hotel Alpi as it was priced right [165E], and 5 min. walk from Termini Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great winter trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tigs1
Reviews.Content: I visited Hotel Alpi last January with my mother. The hotel is fantastic - great staff, great location, great price. I was initially a bit worried about being near Termini as have heard the area is seedy. Alpi seems to be on the safe side of the area though and we found it quiet and felt safe. We booked two rooms and mine was one of the older ones - not very nice. The staff moved me to a better one and it was lovely! IOne slight issue was that is was up on a mezzanine floor with a very small glass lift. It jammed one day which was a bit creepy - it unjammed itself after 1-2 minutes but if you are a bit lift-phobic maybe ask to stay on a different floor! I thought the service was great - efficient and super-friendly. I was ill one day and stayed in and the reception staff called twice to ask if I needed anything from the pharmacy. Breakfast was fine - liked the room it was in. Food the usual Italian cold meats, cheese, pastry etc. as well as cereal and juice. Rome in winter is lovely - not so crowded (although avoid the Vatican on Saint's days of which there are many!) Only minor snag was that a lot of smaller businesses close til mid-Jan. If going again I would try to go a bit later in the month. Hotel was quite busy as school was still out. Wasn't a problem as we had booked far in advance. Recommended this place to my fiance's parents and they stayed over Easter. Were also very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Mkaz
Reviews.Content: We visited rome in may 2007 and stayed in alpi for 6 nights. I had a wonderful time there. The room was of average european size (wont say they were tiny) but most importantly it was very clean and comfortable (which is a challenge to fond in rome), providing us with clean fresh towels everyday. The breakfast was very good with more variety then you can expect in these small hotels. The staff was very helpful and almost all of them speaks good english. The only downside is the location which is on one hand convenient as its close to termini but on the other hand the way to termini is a bit doggy. We did spot some weird looking people when coming back late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NapoliUSA
Reviews.Content: We searched far and wide for a hotel in Rome and this wasn't what we had in mind. I have stayed in 5 hotels in Rome in the last few years and none compare to hotels in other areas of Italy. Simply put, Rome just doesn't offer fantastic accommodations. This hotel varies greatly in its rooms and I saw nothing that represented those presented at their Web site. The room where our friends stayed had a shower in the middle of it with mold. Nothing was comfortable about the hotel. The breakfast too was not good. Keep searching. Although expensive, the Hotel Dei Mellini has been the only comfortable hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: blue13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Alpi in early March with my elderly mother for 4 nights as a birthday treat. Although the hotel's location is hardly anything out of the ordinary, it is very convenient to the main Rome train station. We stayed in a superior room and with the exception of some fraying of the wallpaper in one corner and an unpleasant smell from the bathroom in the early morning, the room was very good. The lift is very small and 2 people is pretty much its limit at any time, not a problem for us, but larger parties may experience inconvenience. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a decent variety of food from fresh fruit, toast, fresh meat & cheese etc. The hotel staff were polite and helpful, but nothing that one wouldn't expect from any good establishment. There are some real gems of cheap restaurants and cafes within minutes walk of the hotel. This advice is hardly earth shattering, but if you try and order in Italian (or even a bad Italian accent!) the level of service does seem to go up a notch or two. As we arrived late at the airport, we ordered the hotel pick up service. It isn't cheap - 50 Euros for up to 4 people and if you have time, or are of the inclination, you can use an express bus for 9 Euros that starts just around the corner from the train station and a 5 minute walk from the hotel. It was very convenient and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: veegal
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from a trip around Italy. We stayed in the Hotel Alpi for 5 nights - from Thurs to a Monday. We booked a triple room and specifically requested a balcony. Based on my experience of hotels in Italy, this hotel was by far and away the best hotel we stayed in. Its in a great location near Termini Station but unlike the other lousy hotels in the area, this one is chique, relatively quiet, and the room we had (Room 247 if i remember correctly) was large with a big bathroom and balcony attached. On the top floor of the hotel is a lovely outside seating area where you can smoke/have a few drinks if you want. The breakfast in the hotel was nice - no fruit though.. if you like croissants, toast, cereal etc you're sorted though and you can eat as much as you like !!! Always good... All in all, from what i've heard of my other friends who stayed in other hotels in Rome, this one was definitely one of the better ones for the price !

Reviews.Title: “Good for Termini station”
Reviews.Author: LondonCatrin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convieniently located near the Termini Station which is great for connections to and from the city but little else. There is a real lack of reasonable resturants and the roads either side of the station should be avoided at all costs. The pictures on the website are misleading. We booked a superior room which had a balcony, which was great, but the bathroom was minute, the jacuzzi bath was broken and the air conditioning didn't work.The room was in need of redoration with dirty carpets and faded upholstory. Some of the staff were helpful but recommendations for resturants were pretty thin on the ground. Bubba Trattatoria just up the road from the hotel was the best of the area. Otherwise options are limited as one of the two underground lines is out of service from 2100 every night until 2008 for repair works. When we checked out we were asked to settle the bill without the same being provided. On consideration of the bill we believed we had been overcharged for the room rate.There was no attempt at compromise on their part and were very aggressive in dealing with matters.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay at Rome!”
Reviews.Author: caitowkway
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Alpi in late Mar 2007. The receptionists (all of them) were warm, friendly and helpful. The clean (triple) room was a joy to return to each night. Room might be a bit small, but comfortable. Breakfast spread's a delight, and substained us all the way till late lunch @ about 3pm. Location wise - it's awesome. Even though it's pretty near to the train station (about 5mins) - we didn't feel uneasy / unsafe when we walked back to Alpi each nite. Most wonderfully, there's a rather big & handy supermarket just across the street, and a really cheap & nice self-service Italian eatery. Only complain would be that it's difficult to take a quick shower. The bathroom's (not sure if it's just our room) more catered to bathtub-soaked baths.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think twice! Stay at Alpi !!!”
Reviews.Author: carlosmonteiro
Reviews.Content: First: I want to tell that i was more than 8 hours reading reviews, almost got crazy, all saying that hotels in rome are bad, tiny and expensive, so my wife was almost crying because i didn't want to go anymore...until i found ALPI! I found this hotel by accident, i didn't want to believe when i saw the price and the quality offered, according to the website. Second: When i arrived at Rome, i noticed that Hotel is very near to the Termini Station, that is the place where you want to stay. Maximum 5 minutes lazy walking with trolleys. Third: Before i entered the hotel i was so afraid what to expect, because i read that hotels in Rome were dirty...but what a surprise when i entered the main door! The entrance looks like a cozy, pleasent residence. Entrance, breakfast room, living room, and terrace very well furnished and good taste in decoration. Fourth: Room is not big, but the confort and decoration WOW!!! For a 3 star hotel you could not expect better...Flat LCD TV with internet and video on demand, ultra modern WC with large shower massage, a/c, minibar, hairdryer, safebox,etc. Fifth: Breakfast...i would give a 4 out 5. They advertise a continental breakfast, but they give you plenty more than that, with a variety of hot dishes (egg, bacon, sausage,etc), fresh food, assortment of pastery, mix of breads, 3 juices, and you can even order a Capucino, you cannot miss it! Overall: For the price payed (75€ double room/night) i never been in such a good hotel in my life (Europe), and believe me i've been in dozens. I want to come back to Rome and i will be definetly staying again at Alpi Hotel. Hope this review does not pop up reserves and they higher their prices, hihi lol. I want to stay more times for 75€ a night!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: reelfeismom4461
Reviews.Content: OMG, where do I even begin. I had e-mailed the hotel manager prior to our stay and expressed to her how important our vacation was,(son just returned from Iraq, and we all needed some R and R especially our son) I stated I needed a suite or any room bigger than a Quad with a terrace. It didn't matter on the cost we just wanted to be comfortable without bumping into each other. She had e-mailed me back stating it would not be a problem. Thank God we were ONLY there 3 nights before going to Florence. First the pictures on the website do not resemble what is fact, except for the front entrance and that small conference room if thats what it's called. The Elevator was a joke, very small could only fit two people with a piece of luggage (we had to bring all of our luggage up ourselves) 2. Our room WAS a Quad, minimal space. I think what bothered me the most was I was told we would have a suite. (I could have booked someplace else but unfortunately I was misinformed, lied to how ever it's interputed. My family and I are not hard people to please, I was just looking for something a little special after almost loosing our son). The terrace you can only stand on, two people at most. no chair would fit let alone anythinng else. When I had stated I was not happy with the accomadations they did offer another room but all were good for 2 MAYBE 3 people Bathroom also very small I understand that this is common in alot of European hotels but again I was told they were very spacious. After coming back from Florence we had to stay in Rome one more night and we stayed in a lovely Hotel near the Trevi Fountian (a real suite). Now we know were to stay on our return to Rome and it would NOT be at Hotel Alpi. As you are well aware of you shouldn't mislead your guests PR (public relations is EVERYTHING) Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - The Alpi”
Reviews.Author: campus607
Reviews.Content: A lovely, clean, convenient, small hotel, ideally situated approximately five minutes walk from the Termini Station. Rooms are small but very well equipped with up-to -date furnishings and modern toilet and showeroom, computer points, on demand TV and films, bar etc., plenty of storage space, just what is needed for a short break in Rome. The bedsheets and towels were changed everyday too. Very convenient, we walked everywhere, but took the metro to the Vatican City, very easy from the Termini Station. Also bus tours etc., set off from there . Hotel staff very friendly and spoke good English. Breakfast was continental style but with loads of choice, we couldn't go wrong, cereals, hams, breads, croissants, toast, jams and preserves, fruit (fresh and tinned), fruit juices, yogurts, cakes, danish pastries, I could go on and on - excellent! An excellent choice for our first stay in Rome and would stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: icecoolcat
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, just five minutes walk from the Termini station. The rooms are modern and very clean, we also found them to be very quiet. Breakfast was continental style with a good choice of cereal, ham, cheese etc. in a very pleasant room. Staff were friendly and spoke English very well. We flew in to Ciampino Airport and took the Terravision bus to the Termini station approx 45 mins away, from there we walked to our hotel, could not have been more convenient. We walked to all the major sights in Rome with no problem, but if you prefer to use public transport this is available from the Termini. Would stay here again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellerniBelfast
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough. Friendly staff, fantastic breakfast, great location, large, comfortable and beautifully finished rooms. We found the best rates by booking with the hotel directly. We will definitely be returning to Rome and the Hotel Alpi!

Reviews.Title: “Would def go back to Alpi”
Reviews.Author: Akasha1631
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Alpi for 2 nights and found this place to be a gem of a find. Hotel was spotless and room was cleaned on a daily basis. Fresh towels daily. We booked a superior room and although we found it to be rather small (would hate to see how small a normal double room was) we were still impressed. Breakfast was a plentiful buffet style continental type and was very nice indeed. Coffee was very tasty and lots of choice to set you on your way for the day. Staff could have been a bit more welcoming but they did let us leave our bags until we had to go so that was good. Location is fantastic. If you get a terravision bus just walk to the top of the street, turn right, cross the road and continue walking down the street. You will find a supermarket on the other side of the road. Cross here and continue walking down. You have two small roads to cross and hey presto, you can see the Hotel Alpi. Sounds far but I promise you its two mins away. We would definately recommend this hotel and will stay there again if we ever go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, small clean room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of Dec, 2006. Best points for hotel is location (3 blocks from Termini which is convenient for metro and buses), cleanliness (5 *), and helpful staff. Downside is neighborhood (slightly rough near station),small room, and only a couple of good restaurants in area. Our room iwas very small for a family of 4 but no other room was available. There iwas fabric on the walls which deadened sound but created a claustrophobic feeling which was not helped by having only 1 window. There was no place to sit in the room at all except on the beds. No dresser or drawers of any kind in room at all. Main beds were comfortable but cots were horribly soft. Overall, if what you want is a clean, convenient, no-frills, and reasonable place to go back to at night to rest, this is a good choice. But do ask for the largest room you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Worth going just for the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: RogueRogan
Reviews.Content: The Alpi is very easy to find from Termini, has a supermarket nearby and several cafe's and bars. Has the world's slowest lift but is a very nicely decorated hotel, staff were helpful and friendly. The room was well laid out and quite clean. During our stay the air conditioning had been turned off due to there being a cold spell the week before, however it certainly needed switching on again! For some reason the layout of our shower was not that hot, it meant a lot of spray getting on the floor, soaking the ensuite. The best thing about the hotel was certainly the continental breakfast, very good selection and the pastries were excellent. Has probably been the best continental breakfast I've had for some time and rivals what you'd get in a local cafe - well worth staying for it and fuelling up for the sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hetan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Hotel Alpi, great value for money. Booked directly with the hotel, which saved approx 20 euro's per night for the deluxe room. Fantastic location, less than 5mins walk from the Termini train station which meant no extra taxi fares to & from the train station. Great supermarket less than a minute away. Metro 5 mins away to all destinations within Rome. Only two negatives were the bath which was a small spa bath(couldn't lie down) with a shower attached to the bath, rather than UP high on the wall & the TV only had 1 English channel unless you paid for other channels. Would reccomend to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcgreiner
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alpi is a reasonably priced small hotel located close to the train station in Rome. At about E100, including a nice breakfast, this was a pleasant surprise. About 3 blocks from the metro and all transportation at the stattione, we were at the center of historic Rome in 10 minutes. Small elevator, somewhat stiff desk staff, but a very nice (though somewhat small) room with 12 foot ceilings, marble bathrooms, and nice beds. Room faced a nice courtyard, with a one story set of stairs (There is a small lift, but it by-passes this area. Our firends also had a jacuzzi, but thier room was taller than it was wide. There is a very pleasant outside veranda on the fifth floor with a bar, but the weather was too cold to enjoy it.. Clean & neat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Alpi”
Reviews.Author: Nelie
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome having spent 3 nights at Hotel Alpi. Lots of research beforehand, and I am really glad I chose this Hotel. There were 5 of us ladies sharing one room, and I was worried it would be cramped, but it was okay. Room was lovely. It was fun chatting together before we went to sleep. There was a king size bed and 3 single beds. We had a shower and there was a hairdryer in the bathroom. We paid 220 euros for the room per night. There was a small balcony off both the bedroom and bathroom. One of the ladies was cold on the first night, so straight after breakfast, on our way back to our room, we asked for 2 extra blankets at reception and when we got back to the room, the blankets had already arrived. Room and bathroom were spotless. Staff on desk were very helpful and good fun. Breakfast was great with huge variety. We saw a few beggars and homeless, but not a lot, and no pickpockets.(though I am sure they were there.) There were gypsies sitting along the wall at Termini but they didnt bother us. After reading other reviews on Rome and the Termini area I was very worried, but was in fact pleasantly surprised. The only downside was, on our first night we ate at Restaurant Osteria(could be splelt wrong). The food was cheap but awful. It is situated further up the street from the hotel but on the opposite side. Avoid it!. Next night we ate at a restaurant just after Babbos. It was full of Italians and food was excellant. We would definitely recommend this Hotel and area. One of the ladies is planning to come back again soon to stay in this Hotel with her family

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Close to Termini, Graet Brekfast”
Reviews.Author: bubbagump07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August. I loved the hotel. It was exactly what we needed. We booked directly with the hotel. Rate was decent in comparission to what oters were charging. The front desk was helpful. Room was above average. We had 4 people in a room so they added extra beds which made the room smaller than normal. However if it had been just the double bed, this room was fantastic. The brekfast kept us going all day. Some had said that the location is too far from everything to which I disagree. The trains lines only intersect at one area "the termini" hence this is a good location to go north south or east west. If you are someone that likes to be in the center of the activity then be preapared to pay the extra money for this convienience. Walking from the hotel to the termini, i agree you WILL come accross homeless people, etc but people this is REAL LIFE and a REAL CITY. Its nothing to worry about and if anything I felt like i was living in a real part of ROME as opposed to a Touristy area. We ended up walking a lot to the places we needed to go and also we took taxis and the metro. The combination of the 3 means of transport made life easy. I checked prices for decent hotels in the CENTER of the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. You get what you pay for and also you loose the ability to be at the axis of the transport hub. Going to Florence or other parts of Italy, then this Termini is where you will come eventually. Be on the lookout for pickpockets at all bus stops, they are in groups of 4-8 and are experts in how to distract you get away with your money. Enroy Rome and Peace.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and central”
Reviews.Author: St39
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel twice and it is very good. Within walking distance of termini station but far enough away from rougher area around station. Well presented, reasonably quiet for central location and very helpful staff - I had made a mistake with my booking dates but they sorted it with no fuss and even upgraded our room. Recommend you book direct on their website, ---, as it tends to be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wannabe-in-Italy
Reviews.Content: Of the four different locations we stayed at in Italy, Hotel Alpi was by far the friendliest and most accommodating. The rooms we booked were deluxe and because we had two rooms for four adults, we were put in the two rooms on the top floor. This may have made the rooms a little warmer than others, but each room had a balcony and the nights were cool enough to sleep with the windows open. I though that the location would be loud being so close to Termini but it was very quiet. The hotel was clean, the people very friendly, the rooms spacious, and the breakfast was very plentiful. The location was great...only a 15 minute walk to Termini. A supermarket was around the corner and there were several great restaurants right there...go to Babbo's if it's the only thing you do! We returned to the hotel on our last night in Rome and our room was even bigger than the first (two double beds, a desk, and a small balcony). This hotel was a great find and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: bnutting
Reviews.Content: Good location close to Termini station. Many restaurants in the locality, reasonably priced and good quality food. Very clean. Porters and breakfast staff friendly and helpful. Reception staff rather aloof, not welcoming. Had rather a poor breakfast of croissant and cake served on the terrace. Final morning excellent breakfast consisting of meats, cheese cereal , fruit , pastries etc in the breakfast room. When we went to pay the final bill we had been charged extra for the pleasure of sitting on the terrace. We had never been told there would be an extra charge. Certainly if we knew there was such a good breakfast indoors we would never have ventured outside. Beware also if you have coffeee on the terrace. They charge you double! Another quibble. The toilet would not flush and was out of action for sixteen hours. We were told it would be repaired but when the staff changed shifts they knew nothing about it.This rather put a damper on an otherwise very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very tiny room”
Reviews.Author: dvg1027
Reviews.Content: Had to make reservations at the last minute and superior rooms were already booked. Based on the other reviews that had superior rooms that is the only way to go. Our room was not a superior room and was tiny, tiny. Had to squeeze between the wall and bottom of bed to get to the other side of the bed. Could only watch tv by sitting on the bed. No room for an extra chair. Couldn't come out of the bathroom if someone was getting something from the closet. On the up side the hotel was extremely clean. One of the cleanest we have ever seen. Also overlooked the courtyard and was very quiet. Breakfast was good and although many tour books do not recommend that area as far as food the hotel clerk recommended a restaurant two blocks away that was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, close to train station, clean and nice peope”
Reviews.Author: gurleylaw
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. Good prices and breakfast. Very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarters
Reviews.Content: Spent a lot of time selecting a hotel for my trip and felt that my research paid off. To save too much reading I will list the + / - Good points Location - 10 mins walk from Terminin station with all bus links and Metro lines. Also buses stops in the nearby square. Amminities - Bars, restaurants and supermarket on the doorstep Rooms - We had a superior room which was very well decorated, clean and tidy Staff - Like most European cities they are friendly. However they are not as forthcoming as UK or USA staff so do not expect the same customer service. The staff were also helpful with suggestions of places to eat and visit Breakfast - Great, good selection but does not change all week Bad points Facilities - The hotel does not supply ironing facilities. Pack that travel iron!! Also no tea/coffee facilities so stear clear of the mini bar. So in conclusion I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. If you look at the reviews, they are in the most praising the Alpi and rightly so. If you have any queries on Rome then please drop me a line, only too happy to help. And a little tip: Visit the Alpi website and book direct through them. I saved 50 Euros by doing this. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Loved it a little”
Reviews.Author: sueand2020
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel after reading other peoples comments on trip advisor. I found them to be helpful and truthful. Hotel was very clean and our maid kept our room spotless. I would agree that you need to ask for a room not overlooking the road as it can be noisy even through the night. All of the desk staff were most helpful and the location near the Termini was useful to get to just about any of the sites. Breakfast was ok, but if you are british 5 of these continental breakfasts are about the max. The staff in the restaurant are also very surprised if you require more than one drink in the morning at breakfast and bearing in mind there are no drink making facilities in the room we felt like we were being naughty to ask for another. That said a nice little hotel and value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive foyer”
Reviews.Author: Popesgrotto
Reviews.Content: The walk from the train station was only marred by some minor roadworks, otherwise just fine. Very attracive foyer and common areas. Staff helpful and friendly. The superior room (as recommended by a previous reviewer) was clean, quiet and comfortable, but the spa bath was small even for a standard bath, and there was only a hand shower. There was the odd sound through the walls, but trivial and nothing that bothered us. Breakfast was good and varied, but the piped music was unnecessary. Convenient location for the tourist bus - buy your ticket in advance in spite of what it says on the side of the bus. All in all a pleasant experience and we would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “The location is not so good...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel were clean but staff with no smile. I am angry because they said they have internet access but when we arrived they said there were problems with connection and suggest me to use the internet cafe somewhere else...We stayed for three days and we never bother to ask again. The location were close to train station and a large supermarket. But we were attacked by Gypsies when we arrived in the noon from the train station to the hotel. And we saw several homeless sleep beside the road on our way back to the hotel in the night. Maybe it would happend anywhere in Rome. Maybe I should blem those problems to Rome city, but it really bothers me and I really don't want to visit this city again...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have recently returned from a 4 day trip to Rome, and I can recommend this hotel for couples and families alike. The room was cleaned daily and was spotless. The room itself (room 112) had a decent sized bathroom with walk in shower. Aswell as a decent sized bedroom it also had a separate small seating area. Breakfast was good and plenty of choice, i.e. cereal, toast, ham, cheese, yoghurts and more. The hotel is located appx 5 minute walk from the Termini station and you can walk to the various attractions, ie Trevi Fountain but would need transportation to the Vatican. One way to get around is to use an open top bus. It gives you the opportunity to either have a tour of the major sites and then as we did, hop on and off at each stop to see the attraction in more detail. This costs 15 euros for a 24 hour pass. (Operator Green Line Travel), but i'm sure other companies will do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in some areas.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Alpi based on the price and reviews. I think the reviews on this hotel are a little over rated. The best part was the location. It was easy to get to transportation. On the other hand, some of the outlets didn't work, there was no iron, so I had to get 10 days worth of clothes pressed at 80 Euro, and there was no hair dryer for my wife. The shower was extremely annoying. It is intended for baths only, there is no shower curtain, and you have to hold the spout in hand, which really agitated my wife when it came to hair washing time. The service was standard, nice people at the desk that spoke English well. The breakfast was good, but after 6 days of the same things, it got kinda old. It was the standard cold cuts, cereals, pastries, fruits, and yogarts. On the home page of the hotel, keep in mind that the pictures are taken by a professional in set lighting. The actual room looks much different. But the room was spacious. The bed was horrible, rock hard, and it kept coming apart because it was two singles pushed together. If you are a younger couple, and you plan on sleeping somewhat close together (or plan on making love)I definatley recommend a hotel with an actual double bed. With all that said, I would definately try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive.”
Reviews.Author: Trippy
Reviews.Content: Just back from two nights stay at Hotel Alpi with my 12 year old daughter. We both loved it there and would go back anytime. Having read through the reviews it seems to have had some problems in the past.I think this place will go up in the ratings very quickly now and deservedly so. We paid 95 Euro a night for a spacious twin(247) overlooking the central courtyard. Suspect we were bumped up for booking well in advance as max room rate on statatory form in room showed 280 Euro. Our price included their, previously reported, legendary breakfast. Very friendly and considerate staff. They let us book in early and leave bags all day today senza problemi! The location is good, if like us you are looking to do a lot of travelling around. Termini is the major hub for transportation. No problems at all in the area, night or day. Lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, a little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: annefIreland
Reviews.Content: Great hotel , so easy for the bus station booked superior room as seen in photos , but not anything like the pics. no 4 poster bed, basic room with well worn furniture, would not complain though really spotless clean, warm and cosy after all you only need a bed , which i must add was changed daily the public areas were spotless and well kept really enjoyed my stay here and would def. stay there again breakfast was very good, even down to the variety of teas offered

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clo234
Reviews.Content: the room is very clean and everythg was great. location is 10 mins walking from the termini station. i was in rome for a week and i stayed in alpi for 2 night, this is the best hotel of them all. i really liked it and delighted that i was staying in this hotel. the only thg that is not too good is the soundproof was bad. i can hear next room talking 'clearly' feel less privatcy, that is all. breakfast was good, all the basic need is there. i would recommand ppl to try this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: allbax
Reviews.Content: Recently spent three nights at the Alpi Hotel in Rome. Not the best location in Rome for late night walking, too near the Termini, but overall a smart, clean and well presented hotel that is ideal for a weekend base to walk about in Rome.
